summary: Completed comprehensive testing of ODDSIDE social features (user search, invites, badges). All 20 backend API tests passed (100%). Frontend loads correctly with proper Supabase authentication integration. Protected routes redirect to login as expected.

minor.issue: Unused variable 'chip_discrepancy' - minor code quality issue

passed_tests: API root endpoint (/api/) returns correct message
API health check
Auth /api/auth/me with valid session token
Auth /api/auth/me without token returns 401
User search /api/users/search requires authentication
User search /api/users/search with valid query returns results
User search /api/users/search with short query returns empty
Get invites /api/users/invites requires authentication
Get invites /api/users/invites returns list
Get badges /api/users/me/badges requires authentication
Get badges /api/users/me/badges returns badge data with level, stats, badges
Create group /api/groups POST creates group successfully
Get groups /api/groups returns user's groups
Get group details /api/groups/{id} returns group with members
Invite member /api/groups/{id}/invite requires authentication
Invite member to non-existent group returns 403
Full invite member flow works correctly
Get stats /api/stats/me returns user statistics
Get notifications /api/notifications returns list
Get balances /api/ledger/balances returns balance data
Landing page loads with ODDSIDE branding
Signup page loads with all form elements
Login page loads with all form elements
Protected routes redirect to login when not authenticated
critical_code_review_comments: ESLint warnings in InviteMembers.jsx for React hooks dependencies - not blocking but should be addressed

success_rate.frontend: 100% (all pages load correctly, protected routes work)

seed_data_creation: Created test user (test-user-1770400891447) and session token (test_session_1770400891447) in MongoDB for API testing
context_for_next_testing_agent: All social features (user search, invites, badges) are working correctly. Backend APIs are fully functional. Frontend uses Supabase authentication - to test authenticated pages, you need to either use Supabase credentials or modify the AuthContext to support session token fallback in the frontend. Test session token: test_session_1770400891447

mocked_apis.email_notifications: Email sending for invites to non-registered users is MOCKED - invites are stored but no email is sent
